trans-unit.source: Deploy a web app in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Deploy a web app in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Learn what methods are available for deploying content to Web Apps.
trans-unit.target: Learn what methods are available for deploying content to Web Apps.

trans-unit.source: Deploy a web app in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Deploy a web app in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: You have many options for deploying your own content to [App Service Web Apps](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714).
trans-unit.target: You have many options for deploying your own content to [App Service Web Apps](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714).

trans-unit.source: This topic provides a brief overview of each option and links to more information.
trans-unit.target: This topic provides a brief overview of each option and links to more information.

trans-unit.source: Deploy from a cloud-hosted source control system
trans-unit.target: Deploy from a cloud-hosted source control system

trans-unit.source: The best way to deploy a web app is to set up a [continuous delivery workflow](http://www.asp.net/aspnet/overview/developing-apps-with-windows-azure/building-real-world-cloud-apps-with-windows-azure/continuous-integration-and-continuous-delivery) integrated with your [source control system](http://asp.net/aspnet/overview/developing-apps-with-windows-azure/building-real-world-cloud-apps-with-windows-azure/source-control).
trans-unit.target: The best way to deploy a web app is to set up a [continuous delivery workflow](http://www.asp.net/aspnet/overview/developing-apps-with-windows-azure/building-real-world-cloud-apps-with-windows-azure/continuous-integration-and-continuous-delivery) integrated with your [source control system](http://asp.net/aspnet/overview/developing-apps-with-windows-azure/building-real-world-cloud-apps-with-windows-azure/source-control).

trans-unit.source: Automation not only makes the development process more efficient but also can make your backup and restore processes more manageable and reliable.
trans-unit.target: Automation not only makes the development process more efficient but also can make your backup and restore processes more manageable and reliable.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have source control set up yet, the easiest way to get started is to use a cloud-hosted source control system.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have source control set up yet, the easiest way to get started is to use a cloud-hosted source control system.

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio Online
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio Online

trans-unit.source: Repository websites using Git
trans-unit.target: Repository websites using Git

trans-unit.source: Repository websites using Mercurial
trans-unit.target: Repository websites using Mercurial

trans-unit.source: Dropbox
trans-unit.target: Dropbox

trans-unit.source: Deploying from an IDE
trans-unit.target: Deploying from an IDE

trans-unit.source: [Visual Studio](http://www.visualstudio.com/) and [WebMatrix](http://www.microsoft.com/web/webmatrix/) are Microsoft IDEs (integrated development environments) that you can use for web development.
trans-unit.target: [Visual Studio](http://www.visualstudio.com/) and [WebMatrix](http://www.microsoft.com/web/webmatrix/) are Microsoft IDEs (integrated development environments) that you can use for web development.

trans-unit.source: Both provide built-in features that make it easy to deploy a web app.
trans-unit.target: Both provide built-in features that make it easy to deploy a web app.

trans-unit.source: Both can use [Web Deploy](http://www.iis.net/downloads/microsoft/web-deploy) to automate additional deployment-related tasks such as database deployment and connection string changes.
trans-unit.target: Both can use [Web Deploy](http://www.iis.net/downloads/microsoft/web-deploy) to automate additional deployment-related tasks such as database deployment and connection string changes.

trans-unit.source: Both can also deploy by using [FTP or FTPS](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File_Transfer_Protocol)).
trans-unit.target: Both can also deploy by using [FTP or FTPS](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File_Transfer_Protocol)).

trans-unit.source: WebMatrix is quick to install and easy to learn, but Visual Studio offers many more features for working with Web Apps.
trans-unit.target: WebMatrix is quick to install and easy to learn, but Visual Studio offers many more features for working with Web Apps.

trans-unit.source: From within the Visual Studio IDE you can create, stop, start, and delete web apps, you can view logs as they are created in real-time, you can debug remotely, and much more.
trans-unit.target: From within the Visual Studio IDE you can create, stop, start, and delete web apps, you can view logs as they are created in real-time, you can debug remotely, and much more.

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio also integrates with source control systems such as [Visual Studio Online](#vso), [Team Foundation Server](#tfs), and [Git repositories](#git).
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio also integrates with source control systems such as [Visual Studio Online](#vso), [Team Foundation Server](#tfs), and [Git repositories](#git).

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: WebMatrix
trans-unit.target: WebMatrix

trans-unit.source: Deploy using an FTP utility
trans-unit.target: Deploy using an FTP utility

trans-unit.source: Regardless of what IDE you use, you can also deploy content to your App by using [FTP](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File_Transfer_Protocol) to copy files.
trans-unit.target: Regardless of what IDE you use, you can also deploy content to your App by using [FTP](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File_Transfer_Protocol) to copy files.

trans-unit.source: It's easy to create FTP credentials for a web app, and you can use them in any application that works with FTP, including browsers such as Internet Explorer and full-featured free utilities such as [FileZilla](https://filezilla-project.org/).
trans-unit.target: It's easy to create FTP credentials for a web app, and you can use them in any application that works with FTP, including browsers such as Internet Explorer and full-featured free utilities such as [FileZilla](https://filezilla-project.org/).

trans-unit.source: Web Apps also supports the more secure FTPS protocol.
trans-unit.target: Web Apps also supports the more secure FTPS protocol.

trans-unit.source: Although it's easy to copy your web app's files to Azure using FTP utilities, they don't automatically take care of or coordinate related deployment tasks such as deploying a database or changing connection strings.
trans-unit.target: Although it's easy to copy your web app's files to Azure using FTP utilities, they don't automatically take care of or coordinate related deployment tasks such as deploying a database or changing connection strings.

trans-unit.source: Also, many FTP tools don't compare source and destination files in order to skip copying files that haven't changed.
trans-unit.target: Also, many FTP tools don't compare source and destination files in order to skip copying files that haven't changed.

trans-unit.source: For large Apps, always copying all files can result in long deployment times even for minor updates since all files are always copied.
trans-unit.target: For large Apps, always copying all files can result in long deployment times even for minor updates since all files are always copied.

trans-unit.source: Deploying from an on-premises source control system
trans-unit.target: Deploying from an on-premises source control system

trans-unit.source: If you are using TFS, Git, or Mercurial in an on-premises (not cloud-hosted) repository, you can deploy directly from your repository to a web app.
trans-unit.target: If you are using TFS, Git, or Mercurial in an on-premises (not cloud-hosted) repository, you can deploy directly from your repository to a web app.

trans-unit.source: Team Foundation Server (TFS)
trans-unit.target: Team Foundation Server (TFS)

trans-unit.source: On-premises Git or Mercurial repositories
trans-unit.target: On-premises Git or Mercurial repositories

trans-unit.source: Deploy using command-line tools and the Azure REST management API
trans-unit.target: Deploy using command-line tools and the Azure REST management API

trans-unit.source: It's always best to automate your development workflow, but if you can't do that directly in your source control system, you can set it up manually by using command-line tools.
trans-unit.target: It's always best to automate your development workflow, but if you can't do that directly in your source control system, you can set it up manually by using command-line tools.

trans-unit.source: This generally involves the use of more than one tool or framework, as deployment often involves performing site management functions as well as copying content.
trans-unit.target: This generally involves the use of more than one tool or framework, as deployment often involves performing site management functions as well as copying content.

trans-unit.source: Azure simplifies site management tasks that you might have to do for deployment by providing a REST management API and several frameworks that make it easier to work with the API.
trans-unit.target: Azure simplifies site management tasks that you might have to do for deployment by providing a REST management API and several frameworks that make it easier to work with the API.

trans-unit.target: FTP

trans-unit.source: Octopus Deploy
trans-unit.target: Octopus Deploy

trans-unit.source: [Octopus Deploy](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Octopus_Deploy) can be used with App Service Web Apps.
trans-unit.target: [Octopus Deploy](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Octopus_Deploy) can be used with App Service Web Apps.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Deploy ASP.NET applications to Azure Web Sites](https://octopusdeploy.com/blog/deploy-aspnet-applications-to-azure-websites).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Deploy ASP.NET applications to Azure Web Sites](https://octopusdeploy.com/blog/deploy-aspnet-applications-to-azure-websites).

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio Online
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio Online

trans-unit.source: [Visual Studio Online](http://www.visualstudio.com/) (formerly Team Foundation Service) is Microsoft's cloud-based solution for source control and team collaboration.
trans-unit.target: [Visual Studio Online](http://www.visualstudio.com/) (formerly Team Foundation Service) is Microsoft's cloud-based solution for source control and team collaboration.

trans-unit.source: The service is free for a team of up to 5 developers.
trans-unit.target: The service is free for a team of up to 5 developers.

trans-unit.source: You can do continuous delivery to a web app in App Services, and your repository can use either [Git or TFVC](http://www.asp.net/aspnet/overview/developing-apps-with-windows-azure/building-real-world-cloud-apps-with-windows-azure/source-control#gittfs).
trans-unit.target: You can do continuous delivery to a web app in App Services, and your repository can use either [Git or TFVC](http://www.asp.net/aspnet/overview/developing-apps-with-windows-azure/building-real-world-cloud-apps-with-windows-azure/source-control#gittfs).

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the following resources:
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the following resources:

trans-unit.source: [Continuous delivery to Azure using Visual Studio Online and TFVC](../cloud-services-continuous-delivery-use-vso.md).
trans-unit.target: [Continuous delivery to Azure using Visual Studio Online and TFVC](../cloud-services-continuous-delivery-use-vso.md).

trans-unit.source: Step-by-step tutorial that shows how to set up continuous delivery from Visual Studio Online to a web app, using TFVC.
trans-unit.target: Step-by-step tutorial that shows how to set up continuous delivery from Visual Studio Online to a web app, using TFVC.

trans-unit.source: TFVC is the centralized source control option, as opposed to Git, which is the distributed source control option.
trans-unit.target: TFVC is the centralized source control option, as opposed to Git, which is the distributed source control option.

trans-unit.source: [Continuous delivery to Azure using Visual Studio Online and Git](../cloud-services-continuous-delivery-use-vso-git.md).
trans-unit.target: [Continuous delivery to Azure using Visual Studio Online and Git](../cloud-services-continuous-delivery-use-vso-git.md).

trans-unit.source: Similar to the previous tutorial but uses Git instead of TFVC.
trans-unit.target: Similar to the previous tutorial but uses Git instead of TFVC.

trans-unit.source: Repository websites using Git
trans-unit.target: Repository websites using Git

trans-unit.source: [Git](http://www.asp.net/aspnet/overview/developing-apps-with-windows-azure/building-real-world-cloud-apps-with-windows-azure/source-control#gittfs) is a popular distributed source control system.
trans-unit.target: [Git](http://www.asp.net/aspnet/overview/developing-apps-with-windows-azure/building-real-world-cloud-apps-with-windows-azure/source-control#gittfs) is a popular distributed source control system.

trans-unit.source: Azure has built-in features that make it easy to automate deployment to a web app from popular web-based repository sites that store Git repositories, including [GitHub](http://www.github.com), [CodePlex](http://www.codeplex.com/), and [BitBucket](https://bitbucket.org/).
trans-unit.target: Azure has built-in features that make it easy to automate deployment to a web app from popular web-based repository sites that store Git repositories, including [GitHub](http://www.github.com), [CodePlex](http://www.codeplex.com/), and [BitBucket](https://bitbucket.org/).

trans-unit.source: An advantage of using Git to deploy is that it's relatively easy to roll back to an earlier deployment if that ever becomes necessary.
trans-unit.target: An advantage of using Git to deploy is that it's relatively easy to roll back to an earlier deployment if that ever becomes necessary.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the following resources:
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the following resources:

trans-unit.source: [Publishing from Source Control to Web Apps with Git](web-sites-publish-source-control.md).
trans-unit.target: [Publishing from Source Control to Web Apps with Git](web-sites-publish-source-control.md).

trans-unit.source: How to use Git to publish directly from your local computer to Web Apps (in Azure, this method of publishing is called Local Git).
trans-unit.target: How to use Git to publish directly from your local computer to Web Apps (in Azure, this method of publishing is called Local Git).

trans-unit.source: Also shows how to enable continuous deployment of Git repositories from GitHub, CodePlex, or BitBucket.
trans-unit.target: Also shows how to enable continuous deployment of Git repositories from GitHub, CodePlex, or BitBucket.

trans-unit.source: [Deploying to Web Apps with GitHub using Kudu](http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/deploying-to-azure-from-github/).
trans-unit.target: [Deploying to Web Apps with GitHub using Kudu](http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/deploying-to-azure-from-github/).

trans-unit.source: Video by Scott Hanselman and David Ebbo that shows how to deploy a web app directly from GitHub to Web Apps.
trans-unit.target: Video by Scott Hanselman and David Ebbo that shows how to deploy a web app directly from GitHub to Web Apps.

trans-unit.source: [Deploy to Azure Button for Web Apps](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2014/11/13/deploy-to-azure-button-for-azure-websites-2/).
trans-unit.target: [Deploy to Azure Button for Web Apps](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2014/11/13/deploy-to-azure-button-for-azure-websites-2/).

trans-unit.source: Blog about a method for triggering deployment from a Git repository.
trans-unit.target: Blog about a method for triggering deployment from a Git repository.

trans-unit.source: [Azure Forum for Git, Mercurial, and Dropbox](http://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/windowsazure/home?forum=azuregit).
trans-unit.target: [Azure Forum for Git, Mercurial, and Dropbox](http://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/windowsazure/home?forum=azuregit).

trans-unit.source: Repository websites using Mercurial
trans-unit.target: Repository websites using Mercurial

trans-unit.source: If you use [Mercurial](http://mercurial.selenic.com/) as your source control system and store your repository in [CodePlex](http://www.codeplex.com/) or [BitBucket](https://bitbucket.org/), you can use built-in features in Azure App Service to automatically deploy your content.
trans-unit.target: If you use [Mercurial](http://mercurial.selenic.com/) as your source control system and store your repository in [CodePlex](http://www.codeplex.com/) or [BitBucket](https://bitbucket.org/), you can use built-in features in Azure App Service to automatically deploy your content.

trans-unit.source: For information about how to deploy using Mercurial, see the following resources:
trans-unit.target: For information about how to deploy using Mercurial, see the following resources:

trans-unit.source: [Publishing from Source Control to Web Apps with Git](web-sites-publish-source-control.md).
trans-unit.target: [Publishing from Source Control to Web Apps with Git](web-sites-publish-source-control.md).

trans-unit.source: Although this tutorial shows how to publish a Git repository, the process for Mercurial repositories hosted in CodePlex or BitBucket is similar.
trans-unit.target: Although this tutorial shows how to publish a Git repository, the process for Mercurial repositories hosted in CodePlex or BitBucket is similar.

trans-unit.source: [Azure Forum for Git, Mercurial, and Dropbox](http://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/windowsazure/home?forum=azuregit).
trans-unit.target: [Azure Forum for Git, Mercurial, and Dropbox](http://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/windowsazure/home?forum=azuregit).

trans-unit.source: Dropbox
trans-unit.target: Dropbox

trans-unit.source: [Dropbox](https://www.dropbox.com/) is not a source control system, but if you store your source code in Dropbox you can automate deployment from your Dropbox account.
trans-unit.target: [Dropbox](https://www.dropbox.com/) is not a source control system, but if you store your source code in Dropbox you can automate deployment from your Dropbox account.

trans-unit.source: [Deploy To Web Apps from Dropbox](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/windowsazure/archive/2013/03/19/new-deploy-to-windows-azure-web-sites-from-dropbox.aspx).
trans-unit.target: [Deploy To Web Apps from Dropbox](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/windowsazure/archive/2013/03/19/new-deploy-to-windows-azure-web-sites-from-dropbox.aspx).

trans-unit.source: How to use the [Azure Portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529715) to set up Dropbox deployment.
trans-unit.target: How to use the [Azure Portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529715) to set up Dropbox deployment.

trans-unit.source: [Dropbox Deployment to Web Apps](http://channel9.msdn.com/Series/Windows-Azure-Web-Sites-Tutorials/Dropbox-Deployment-to-Windows-Azure-Web-Sites).
trans-unit.target: [Dropbox Deployment to Web Apps](http://channel9.msdn.com/Series/Windows-Azure-Web-Sites-Tutorials/Dropbox-Deployment-to-Windows-Azure-Web-Sites).

trans-unit.source: This video walks through the process of connecting a Dropbox folder to a web app and shows how quickly you can get a web app up and running or maintain it using simple drag-and-drop deployment.
trans-unit.target: This video walks through the process of connecting a Dropbox folder to a web app and shows how quickly you can get a web app up and running or maintain it using simple drag-and-drop deployment.

trans-unit.source: [Azure Forum for Git, Mercurial, and Dropbox](http://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/windowsazure/home?forum=azuregit).
trans-unit.target: [Azure Forum for Git, Mercurial, and Dropbox](http://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/windowsazure/home?forum=azuregit).

trans-unit.source: Team Foundation Server (TFS)
trans-unit.target: Team Foundation Server (TFS)

trans-unit.source: Team Foundation Server is Microsoft's on-premises solution for source control and team collaboration.
trans-unit.target: Team Foundation Server is Microsoft's on-premises solution for source control and team collaboration.

trans-unit.source: You can set up TFS to do continuous delivery to a web app.
trans-unit.target: You can set up TFS to do continuous delivery to a web app.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the following resource:
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the following resource:

trans-unit.target: [Continuous Delivery for Cloud Services in Azure](../cloud-services-dotnet-continuous-delivery.md).

trans-unit.source: This document is for an Azure Cloud Service, but some of its content is relevant to Web Apps.
trans-unit.target: This document is for an Azure Cloud Service, but some of its content is relevant to Web Apps.

trans-unit.source: On-premises Git or Mercurial repositories
trans-unit.target: On-premises Git or Mercurial repositories

trans-unit.source: In Azure you can enter the URL of any repository that uses Git or Mercurial in order to deploy from that location.
trans-unit.target: In Azure you can enter the URL of any repository that uses Git or Mercurial in order to deploy from that location.

trans-unit.source: You can also directly push from a local Git repository to a web app.
trans-unit.target: You can also directly push from a local Git repository to a web app.

trans-unit.target: Also shows how to enable continuous deployment of Git repositories from GitHub, CodePlex, or BitBucket.

trans-unit.target: [Publishing to Web Apps from any git/hg repo](http://blog.davidebbo.com/2013/04/publishing-to-azure-web-sites-from-any.html).

trans-unit.target: Blog that explains the "External Repository" feature in Web Apps.

trans-unit.source: MSBuild
trans-unit.target: MSBuild

trans-unit.source: If you use the [Visual Studio IDE](#vs) for development, you can use [MSBuild](http://msbuildbook.com/) to automate anything you can do in your IDE.
trans-unit.target: If you use the [Visual Studio IDE](#vs) for development, you can use [MSBuild](http://msbuildbook.com/) to automate anything you can do in your IDE.

trans-unit.source: You can configure MSBuild to use either [Web Deploy](#webdeploy) or [FTP/FTPS](#ftp) to copy files.
trans-unit.target: You can configure MSBuild to use either [Web Deploy](#webdeploy) or [FTP/FTPS](#ftp) to copy files.

trans-unit.source: Web Deploy can also automate many other deployment-related tasks, such as deploying databases.
trans-unit.target: Web Deploy can also automate many other deployment-related tasks, such as deploying databases.

trans-unit.source: For more information about command-line deployment using MSBuild, see the following resources:
trans-unit.target: For more information about command-line deployment using MSBuild, see the following resources:

trans-unit.source: [ASP.NET Web Deployment using Visual Studio: Command Line Deployment](http://www.asp.net/mvc/tutorials/deployment/visual-studio-web-deployment/command-line-deployment).
trans-unit.target: [ASP.NET Web Deployment using Visual Studio: Command Line Deployment](http://www.asp.net/mvc/tutorials/deployment/visual-studio-web-deployment/command-line-deployment).

trans-unit.source: Tenth in a series of tutorials about deployment to Azure using Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: Tenth in a series of tutorials about deployment to Azure using Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Shows how to use the command line to deploy after setting up publish profiles in Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: Shows how to use the command line to deploy after setting up publish profiles in Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: [Inside the Microsoft Build Engine: Using MSBuild and Team Foundation Build](http://msbuildbook.com/).
trans-unit.target: [Inside the Microsoft Build Engine: Using MSBuild and Team Foundation Build](http://msbuildbook.com/).

trans-unit.source: Hard-copy book that includes chapters on how to use MSBuild for deployment.
trans-unit.target: Hard-copy book that includes chapters on how to use MSBuild for deployment.

trans-unit.source: FTP scripts
trans-unit.target: FTP scripts

trans-unit.source: It's easy to create [FTP/FTPS](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File_Transfer_Protocol) credentials for a web app, and you can then use those credentials with FTP batch scripts.
trans-unit.target: It's easy to create [FTP/FTPS](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File_Transfer_Protocol) credentials for a web app, and you can then use those credentials with FTP batch scripts.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the following resource:
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the following resource:

trans-unit.source: [Using FTP Batch Scripts](http://support.microsoft.com/kb/96269).
trans-unit.target: [Using FTP Batch Scripts](http://support.microsoft.com/kb/96269).

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell

trans-unit.source: You can perform MSBuild or FTP deployment functions from [Windows PowerShell](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dd835506.aspx).
trans-unit.target: You can perform MSBuild or FTP deployment functions from [Windows PowerShell](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dd835506.aspx).

trans-unit.source: If you do that, you can also use a collection of Windows PowerShell cmdlets that make the Azure REST management API easy to call.
trans-unit.target: If you do that, you can also use a collection of Windows PowerShell cmdlets that make the Azure REST management API easy to call.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the following resources:
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the following resources:

trans-unit.target: Deploy a web app linked to a GitHub repository

trans-unit.target: Provision a web app with a SQL Database

trans-unit.target: Provision and deploy microservices predictably in Azure

trans-unit.target: [Building Real-World Cloud Apps with Azure - Automate Everything](http://asp.net/aspnet/overview/developing-apps-with-windows-azure/building-real-world-cloud-apps-with-windows-azure/automate-everything).

trans-unit.target: E-book chapter that explains how the sample application shown in the e-book uses Windows PowerShell scripts to create an Azure test environment and deploy to it.

trans-unit.source: See the [Resources](http://asp.net/aspnet/overview/developing-apps-with-windows-azure/building-real-world-cloud-apps-with-windows-azure/automate-everything#resources) section for links to additional Azure PowerShell documentation.
trans-unit.target: See the [Resources](http://asp.net/aspnet/overview/developing-apps-with-windows-azure/building-real-world-cloud-apps-with-windows-azure/automate-everything#resources) section for links to additional Azure PowerShell documentation.

trans-unit.target: [Using Windows PowerShell Scripts to Publish to Dev and Test Environments](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn642480.aspx).

trans-unit.source: How to use Windows PowerShell deployment scripts that Visual Studio generates.
trans-unit.target: How to use Windows PowerShell deployment scripts that Visual Studio generates.

trans-unit.source: .NET management API
trans-unit.target: .NET management API

trans-unit.source: You can write C# code to perform MSBuild or FTP functions for deployment.
trans-unit.target: You can write C# code to perform MSBuild or FTP functions for deployment.

trans-unit.source: If you do that, you can access the Azure management REST API to perform site management functions.
trans-unit.target: If you do that, you can access the Azure management REST API to perform site management functions.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the following resource:
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the following resource:

trans-unit.source: [Automating everything with the Azure Management Libraries and .NET](http://www.hanselman.com/blog/PennyPinchingInTheCloudAutomatingEverythingWithTheWindowsAzureManagementLibrariesAndNET.aspx).
trans-unit.target: [Automating everything with the Azure Management Libraries and .NET](http://www.hanselman.com/blog/PennyPinchingInTheCloudAutomatingEverythingWithTheWindowsAzureManagementLibrariesAndNET.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Introduction to the .NET management API and links to more documentation.
trans-unit.target: Introduction to the .NET management API and links to more documentation.

trans-unit.source: Azure Command-Line Interface (Azure CLI)
trans-unit.target: Azure Command-Line Interface (Azure CLI)

trans-unit.source: You can use the command line in Windows, Mac or Linux machines to deploy by using FTP.
trans-unit.target: You can use the command line in Windows, Mac or Linux machines to deploy by using FTP.

trans-unit.source: If you do that, you can also access the Azure REST management API using the Azure CLI.
trans-unit.target: If you do that, you can also access the Azure REST management API using the Azure CLI.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the following resource:
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the following resource:

trans-unit.source: [Azure Command line tools](/downloads/#cmd-line-tools).
trans-unit.target: [Azure Command line tools](/downloads/#cmd-line-tools).

trans-unit.source: Portal page in Azure.com for command line tool information.
trans-unit.target: Portal page in Azure.com for command line tool information.

trans-unit.source: Web Deploy command line
trans-unit.target: Web Deploy command line

trans-unit.source: [Web Deploy](http://www.iis.net/downloads/microsoft/web-deploy) is Microsoft software for deployment to IIS that not only provides intelligent file sync features but also can perform or coordinate many other deployment-related tasks that can't be automated when you use FTP.
trans-unit.target: [Web Deploy](http://www.iis.net/downloads/microsoft/web-deploy) is Microsoft software for deployment to IIS that not only provides intelligent file sync features but also can perform or coordinate many other deployment-related tasks that can't be automated when you use FTP.

trans-unit.source: For example, Web Deploy can deploy a new database or database updates along with your web app.
trans-unit.target: For example, Web Deploy can deploy a new database or database updates along with your web app.

trans-unit.source: Web Deploy can also minimize the time required to update an existing site since it can intelligently copy only changed files.
trans-unit.target: Web Deploy can also minimize the time required to update an existing site since it can intelligently copy only changed files.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft WebMatrix, Visual Studio, Visual Studio Online, and Team Foundation Server have support for Web Deploy built-in, but you can also use Web Deploy directly from the command line to automate deployment.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft WebMatrix, Visual Studio, Visual Studio Online, and Team Foundation Server have support for Web Deploy built-in, but you can also use Web Deploy directly from the command line to automate deployment.

trans-unit.source: Web Deploy commands are very powerful but the learning curve can be steep.
trans-unit.target: Web Deploy commands are very powerful but the learning curve can be steep.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the following resource:
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the following resource:

trans-unit.source: [Simple Web Apps: Deployment](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2014/07/28/simple-azure-websites-deployment/).
trans-unit.target: [Simple Web Apps: Deployment](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2014/07/28/simple-azure-websites-deployment/).

trans-unit.source: Blog by David Ebbo about a tool he wrote to make it easier to use Web Deploy.
trans-unit.target: Blog by David Ebbo about a tool he wrote to make it easier to use Web Deploy.

trans-unit.source: [Web Deployment Tool](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/dd568996).
trans-unit.target: [Web Deployment Tool](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/dd568996).

trans-unit.source: Official documentation on the Microsoft TechNet site.
trans-unit.target: Official documentation on the Microsoft TechNet site.

trans-unit.source: Dated but still a good place to start.
trans-unit.target: Dated but still a good place to start.

trans-unit.source: [Using Web Deploy](http://www.iis.net/learn/publish/using-web-deploy).
trans-unit.target: [Using Web Deploy](http://www.iis.net/learn/publish/using-web-deploy).

trans-unit.source: Official documentation on the Microsoft IIS.NET site.
trans-unit.target: Official documentation on the Microsoft IIS.NET site.

trans-unit.source: Also dated but a good place to start.
trans-unit.target: Also dated but a good place to start.

trans-unit.source: [StackOverflow](http://www.stackoverflow.com).
trans-unit.target: [StackOverflow](http://www.stackoverflow.com).

trans-unit.source: The best place to go for more current information about how to use Web Deploy from the command line.
trans-unit.target: The best place to go for more current information about how to use Web Deploy from the command line.

trans-unit.source: [ASP.NET Web Deployment using Visual Studio: Command Line Deployment](http://www.asp.net/mvc/tutorials/deployment/visual-studio-web-deployment/command-line-deployment).
trans-unit.target: [ASP.NET Web Deployment using Visual Studio: Command Line Deployment](http://www.asp.net/mvc/tutorials/deployment/visual-studio-web-deployment/command-line-deployment).

trans-unit.source: MSBuild is the build engine used by Visual Studio, and it can also be used from the command line to deploy web applications to Web Apps.
trans-unit.target: MSBuild is the build engine used by Visual Studio, and it can also be used from the command line to deploy web applications to Web Apps.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is part of a series that is mainly about Visual Studio deployment.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is part of a series that is mainly about Visual Studio deployment.

trans-unit.source: Next Steps
trans-unit.target: Next Steps

trans-unit.source: In some scenarios you might want to be able to easily switch back and forth between a staging and a production version of your web app.
trans-unit.target: In some scenarios you might want to be able to easily switch back and forth between a staging and a production version of your web app.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Staged Deployment on Web Apps](web-sites-staged-publishing.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Staged Deployment on Web Apps](web-sites-staged-publishing.md).

trans-unit.source: Having a backup and restore plan in place is an important part of any deployment workflow.
trans-unit.target: Having a backup and restore plan in place is an important part of any deployment workflow.

trans-unit.source: For information about the Web Apps backup and restore feature, see [Web Apps Backups](web-sites-backup.md).
trans-unit.target: For information about the Web Apps backup and restore feature, see [Web Apps Backups](web-sites-backup.md).

trans-unit.source: For information about how to use Azure's Role-Based Access Control to manage access to Web Apps deployment, see [RBAC and Web App Publishing](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2015/01/05/rbac-and-azure-websites-publishing).
trans-unit.target: For information about how to use Azure's Role-Based Access Control to manage access to Web Apps deployment, see [RBAC and Web App Publishing](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2015/01/05/rbac-and-azure-websites-publishing).

trans-unit.source: For information about other deployment topics, see the Deploy section in [Web Apps Documentation](/documentation/services/web-sites/).
trans-unit.target: For information about other deployment topics, see the Deploy section in [Web Apps Documentation](/documentation/services/web-sites/).
